Getting around in Linux is easy! Go to terminal, type commands and press button ENTER.
pwd - shows where you are right now. (Instead of asking adult "Where are we?", say pwd)
How do I see what is in the folder?

Getting around in Linux is easy! Go to terminal, type commands and press button ENTER.
ls - shows everything that is in the folder (...almost everything)
ls -a - shows even secret files. (Secret files star with a dot ;) )
How do I go to a different folder?

Getting around in Linux is easy! Go to terminal, type commands and press button ENTER.
cd NAME_OF_FOLDER - takes you to the folder! cd Pictures and you are in Pictures folder.
cd .. - this takes you back where you came from.
I want to make my own folder

mkdir NAME_OF_DIRECTORY
Go ahead and type mkdir FunnyNotes. Now type ls. Do you see your folder? cd FunnyNotes pwd You are in folder FunnyNotes!

Delete file by typing: rm NAME_OF_FILE Now type ls Boom! That file is gone!
Delete folder by typing: rm -r NAME_OF_FOLDER Did not work? Make sure you step out of the folder cd .. If you type ls the whole folder is gone!

Many times you need to install other things on your computer. Do this by typing: sudo apt-get NAME_OF_TOOL
sudo means that you are giving special permissions If you have password, you have to type it after a command with sudo.
This command will update your tools: sudo apt-get update

Go to the place where you want to make a secret file. Type: vim .NAME_OF_SECRET_FILE
vim is the program where you can type it up. Make sure you put a dot in front of the name (dot makes it a secret file)
Now press letter i. You can type your secret file now. When you are done: press ESC press symbol : type letters wq and press ENTER
You saved your document by typing wq. If you don't want to save it, press q! instead of wq.
Now do ls - your file is not there! Type ls -a Your file is showing now!
This is the way to keep a secret diary.
